text: Arhopala ate is a butterfly in the family Lycaenidae. It was described by William Chapman Hewitson in 1863. It is found in the Australasian realm.Seitz, A., 1912-1927. Die Indo-Australien Tagfalter Grossschmetterlinge Erde 9 ==Subspecies== * A. a. ate Ambon, Serang * A. a. aruana (Evans, 1957) Aru * A. a. jobina (Evans, 1957) Jobi, Biak, Noemfoor, New Guinea ==References== ==External links== *Arhopala Boisduval, 1832 at Markku Savela's Lepidoptera and Some Other Life Forms. Retrieved June 3, 2017. Category:Arhopala Category:Butterflies described in 1863
title: Arhopala ate
